original: bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Blessed One, the youthful Manjushri.

original: srid pa gsum gyi bla ma dkon mchog gsum la phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa ni 'gro ba rnams kyi mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu mtha' dag skyed pa'i rgyu yin pas na de'i phyir de dag la phyag 'tshal lo /
analyzed: srid pa gsum gyi bla ma dkon mchog gsum la phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa ni 'gro ba rnams kyi mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu mtha' dag skyed pa'i rgyu yin pas na de'i phyir de dag la phyag 'tshal lo /
translated: Homage to the Three Jewels, the gurus of the three worlds, and so forth, because they are the cause for generating all the desired results of beings. Therefore, homage to them.

original: sangs rgyas gtso la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gtso la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Buddha, the foremost.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: And so forth is stated.

original: ma 'dres pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pa dag ma lus par spangs pa ni sangs rgyas te gnyid rab tu sangs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pa dag ma lus par spangs pa ni sangs rgyas te gnyid rab tu sangs pa bzhin no //
translated: The Buddha is the one who has completely abandoned the unmixed and concomitant ignorances, like one who has fully awakened from sleep.

original: yang na nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa spangs pas shes bya mtha' dag la blo rgyas pas rgyas pa ste pad+ma rab tu rgyas pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: yang na nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa spangs pas shes bya mtha' dag la blo rgyas pas rgyas pa ste pad+ma rab tu rgyas pa lta bu'o //
translated: Or else, it is expansion because the mind expands with regard to all objects of knowledge by abandoning non-afflicted nescience.

original: de ltar na de dag gi ni spangs pa dang ye shes phun sum tshogs pas bstod pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar na de dag gi ni spangs pa dang ye shes phun sum tshogs pas bstod pa ste /
translated: Thus, they are praised because of their perfection of abandonment and knowledge.

original: nyid kyi don phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: nyid kyi don phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: This is the perfection of one's own aim.

original: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du byas te /
translated: With regard to the perfection of the aim of others,

original: gtso zhes smos pa las sa gsum gyi dbang phyug chen por gyur pas na gtso bo ste /
analyzed: gtso zhes smos pa las sa gsum gyi dbang phyug chen por gyur pas na gtso bo ste /
translated: it is said that they are chief, and since they are the great lords of the three realms, they are chief.

original: de dag ma lus pas 'don pas lci ba ni gzugs la la lci bar gyur pas srong gi mgo gnon pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de dag ma lus pas 'don pas lci ba ni gzugs la la lci bar gyur pas srong gi mgo gnon pa lta bu'o //
translated: Since they are all recited, they are heavy, like a heavy head that is supported by the neck.

original: des ni thams cad zil gyis mnan nas 'dul zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des ni thams cad zil gyis mnan nas 'dul zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is taught that they subdue by overwhelming all.

original: yang na phyin ci ma log pa'i yon tan rin po che sbyin pas na bla ma ste /
analyzed: yang na phyin ci ma log pa'i yon tan rin po che sbyin pas na bla ma ste /
translated: Or else, they are gurus because they bestow the jewel of unerring good qualities.

original: de la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba ni sgo gsum gyi rab tu 'dud par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba ni sgo gsum gyi rab tu 'dud par byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase I pay homage to him indicates the bowing down of one's body, speech, and mind.

original: skyob pa'i chos la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: skyob pa'i chos la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I pay homage to the Dharma of the protector.

original: zhes bya ba la 'dis ngan 'gro dang srid par sdug bsngal ba las skyob cing sdug bsngal sel la bde ba sbyin pas na skyob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la 'dis ngan 'gro dang srid par sdug bsngal ba las skyob cing sdug bsngal sel la bde ba sbyin pas na skyob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The Dharma is called a protector because it protects one from the suffering of the unfortunate realms and cyclic existence, it removes suffering, and it bestows happiness.

original: de nyid kyis na chos te rnam par ltung ba las 'dzin pas so //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na chos te rnam par ltung ba las 'dzin pas so //
translated: It is also called Dharma because it holds one back from falling into the unfortunate realms.

original: de yang gang gis don dam pa'i chos de rtogs na slar ngan song dang 'khor bar mi ltung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang gang gis don dam pa'i chos de rtogs na slar ngan song dang 'khor bar mi ltung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, it is the ultimate Dharma that is referred to here, because one does not fall back into the unfortunate realms or cyclic existence once one has realized it.

original: de rtogs pa'i rgyud pa'i rgyu ni bstan pa'i chos yin la /
analyzed: de rtogs pa'i rgyud pa'i rgyu ni bstan pa'i chos yin la /
translated: The scriptural Dharma is the indirect cause for realizing that ultimate Dharma,

original: dngos kyi rgyu ni lam gyi chos yin pas de dag la yang btags te 'dzin pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: dngos kyi rgyu ni lam gyi chos yin pas de dag la yang btags te 'dzin pa zhes brjod do //
translated: while the Dharma of the path is the direct cause for realizing it. Therefore, the scriptural Dharma and the Dharma of the path are also referred to as the Dharma that is to be held.

original: yang na skyob pa zhes bya bas ni gzhan la phan 'dogs pa phun sum tshogs @105b pa bstan la /
analyzed: yang na skyob pa zhes bya bas ni gzhan la phan 'dogs pa phun sum tshogs @105b pa bstan la /
translated: Alternatively, the phrase the protector indicates the perfection of benefiting others,🔽 while the phrase the Dharma of the protector indicates the perfection of benefiting oneself.

original: chos zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid rnam par dag pa 'dzin pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid rnam par dag pa 'dzin pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //

analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni shes bya'i sgrib pa mtha' dag kyang spangs la /
translated: The perfectly enlightened one is also the one who abandons all the obstructions to omniscience.

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs mtha' dag kyang rdzogs pas dge 'dun gyi nang du bgrang bar bya ba ma yin la /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs mtha' dag kyang rdzogs pas dge 'dun gyi nang du bgrang bar bya ba ma yin la /
translated: And since he has completed all the collections of merit, he is not to be counted among the saṅgha.

analyzed: sa gsum gyi 'gro ba dam pa dang slob pa dang mi slob pa thams cad kyis mchod par 'os pas dgra bcom pa chen po zhes ni bya'o //
translated: But he is to be called a great arhat because he is worthy of worship by all the holy beings of the three worlds, by all those in training and beyond training.

original: de ltar mi phyed pa ni rang gi don thob pa yin la /
analyzed: de ltar mi phyed pa ni rang gi don thob pa yin la /
translated: Thus, he is not divided into those who have attained their own goal and those who have not.

original: gzhan gyi don thob par byed pa'i phyir che zhes smos so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don thob par byed pa'i phyir che zhes smos so //
translated: But he is called great because he accomplishes the goals of others.

original: 'di dag gzhan gyi yon sbyong ba che bas na chen po ste ;
analyzed: 'di dag gzhan gyi yon sbyong ba che bas na chen po ste ;
translated: They are great because they purify the qualities of others.

original: bul ba dang yongs su longs spyod pa gnyis kyis 'gro ba'i rdzas las byung ba'i bsod nams mchog 'phel ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: bul ba dang yongs su longs spyod pa gnyis kyis 'gro ba'i rdzas las byung ba'i bsod nams mchog 'phel ba'i phyir te /
translated: They are the best because they increase the merit that comes from material generosity to beings through the two activities of being slow to anger and being very helpful.

original: de yang slob pa dang mi slob pa de dag ni ci rigs par sred pa'i cha shas lhag ma lus zas dang gos la sogs pa la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags phra mo bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yod pa dang / sngon gyi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu phung po lnga 'dzin pas zas la sogs pas da dung gso dgos pas longs spyod kyi /
analyzed: de yang slob pa dang mi slob pa de dag ni ci rigs par sred pa'i cha shas lhag ma lus zas dang gos la sogs pa la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags phra mo bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yod pa dang / sngon gyi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu phung po lnga 'dzin pas zas la sogs pas da dung gso dgos pas longs spyod kyi /
translated: And they still need to be sustained by food and so on, since they possess the five aggregates that are the fruitions of former karma.

original: sangs rgyas dang chos ni de lta ma yin pas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang chos ni de lta ma yin pas so //
translated: But the Buddha and Dharma are not like that.

original: de dag la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba ni snga ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de dag la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba ni snga ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: Homage to them is as explained above.

original: gsum po de dag la rtag tu bdag phyag 'tshal zhes bya ba ni don go sla'o //
analyzed: gsum po de dag la rtag tu bdag phyag 'tshal zhes bya ba ni don go sla'o //
translated: I constantly pay homage to those three is easy to understand.

original: de ltar phyag 'tshal ba'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni sangs rgyas kyi mtshan bzang po thams cad kyi gtso bo spyi gtsug bltar mi mthong ba 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar phyag 'tshal ba'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni sangs rgyas kyi mtshan bzang po thams cad kyi gtso bo spyi gtsug bltar mi mthong ba 'thob pa'o //
translated: The fruitional effect of such homage is to attain the invisible crown protuberance, the foremost of all the excellent marks of a buddha.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu la myong ba rgyu mthun ni 'khor bar skye ba na mgo @106a * //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu la myong ba rgyu mthun ni 'khor bar skye ba na mgo @106a * //
translated: The result corresponding to the cause is that when one is born in samsara, one has a long life and is not killed easily.🔽

original: bo gdugs lta bur 'gyur ba dang / dkon mchog gsum la phyag 'tshal ba la dga' bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bo gdugs lta bur 'gyur ba dang / dkon mchog gsum la phyag 'tshal ba la dga' bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The result that resembles the cause is that when one is born in cyclic existence, one’s head becomes like a parasol and one delights in paying homage to the Three Jewels.

original: dbang gi 'bras bu ni phyi rol gyi dngos po yid du 'ong ba rnams de'i shes pa'i yul du 'dud pa ltar snang zhing dgyed pa dang gzung du mi rung ba ltar snang bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang gi 'bras bu ni phyi rol gyi dngos po yid du 'ong ba rnams de'i shes pa'i yul du 'dud pa ltar snang zhing dgyed pa dang gzung du mi rung ba ltar snang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The dominant result is that external things that are attractive appear to bow to one, as if they were the objects of one’s consciousness, and they do not appear to be unobtainable.

original: de ltar dkon mchog gsum la bstod pa mdor gsungs pa de dag rab tu gsal bar bstan pas 'gro ba dam pa rnams de bas kyang shas cher dad par bya ba dang / rang gi tshogs dri ma med pa bsags pa'i phyir slob dpon ma ti tsi ta'i zhal snga nas bstod pa gsungs pa /🔽tshogs chen gnyis rdzogs mkhyen bzhi sku gsum grub //
analyzed: de ltar dkon mchog gsum la bstod pa mdor gsungs pa de dag rab tu gsal bar bstan pas 'gro ba dam pa rnams de bas kyang shas cher dad par bya ba dang / rang gi tshogs dri ma med pa bsags pa'i phyir slob dpon ma ti tsi ta'i zhal snga nas bstod pa gsungs pa / tshogs chen gnyis rdzogs mkhyen bzhi sku gsum grub //
translated: Thus, in order to demonstrate those praises of the Three Jewels that were stated concisely, in order to generate even greater faith in the holy beings of the world, and in order to accumulate one’s own stainless collection, the master Mati Cīti stated the following praises:🔽“You have perfected the two great collections, the four knowledges, and the three bodies.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: 'dis rdzogs par byed pas na tshogs te /
analyzed: 'dis rdzogs par byed pas na tshogs te /
translated: The collection is that which perfects it.🔽

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug go //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug go //
translated: The collection is so called because it perfects the six perfections such as giving.

original: de dag nyid chen po ste rang bzhin dpag tu med pa dang / bskal pa dpag tu med pa dang ; yul dpag tu med pa la bsags pa'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid chen po ste rang bzhin dpag tu med pa dang / bskal pa dpag tu med pa dang ; yul dpag tu med pa la bsags pa'o //
translated: They are great because they are accumulated for an immeasurable time, for immeasurable eons, and in immeasurable objective realms.

original: gnyis zhes bya ba ni bsod nams dang ye shes so //
analyzed: gnyis zhes bya ba ni bsod nams dang ye shes so //
translated: The two are merit and knowledge.

original: de yang sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang / bzod pa ni bsod nams te /
analyzed: de yang sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang / bzod pa ni bsod nams te /
translated: Moreover, giving, morality, and patience are merit,

original: bsam gtan dang shes rab ni ye shes so //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang shes rab ni ye shes so //
translated: and meditative concentration and wisdom are knowledge.

original: brtson 'grus ni de gnyis kar gtogs so zhes 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las gsungs so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni de gnyis kar gtogs so zhes 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las gsungs so //
translated: And effort is included in both, as the noble Unraveling of the Intention teaches.

original: de gnyis rdzogs pa ni bskal pa chen po grangs med pa dang por sbyor ba'i lam sbyangs shing gnyis par sa bdun pa'i bar dang / gsum par sa bcu pa'i bar du sbyangs shing dag par byas pa ni rdzogs shing mthar thug par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de gnyis rdzogs pa ni bskal pa chen po grangs med pa dang por sbyor ba'i lam sbyangs shing gnyis par sa bdun pa'i bar dang / gsum par sa bcu pa'i bar du sbyangs shing dag par byas pa ni rdzogs shing mthar thug par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The perfection of those two is the completion and culmination of the training in the first immeasurable great eon on the path of preparation, the training in the second up to the seventh stage, and the training in the third up to the tenth stage.

original: des ni rgyu khyad par can bsags pa bstan nas /
analyzed: des ni rgyu khyad par can bsags pa bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the accumulation of the special cause,

original: de ni 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir mkhyen bzhi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ni 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir mkhyen bzhi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: in order to teach the result, he says, “the four knowledges,” and so on.

original: mkhyen bzhi ni me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: mkhyen bzhi ni me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa bzhi'o //
translated: The four knowledges are the four beginning with the mirror-like knowledge.

original: de la me long lta bu'i ye shes ni kun gzhi rnam shes gnas gyur pa shes bya thams cad la thogs pa med par mkhyen pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de la me long lta bu'i ye shes ni kun gzhi rnam shes gnas gyur pa shes bya thams cad la thogs pa med par mkhyen pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Among them, the mirror-like knowledge is the knowledge that is the transformation of the consciousness of the ground-of-all, the knowledge that is unobstructed with regard to all objects of knowledge.

original: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid gnas gyur pa bdag med pa la bdag med par mkhyen pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid gnas gyur pa bdag med pa la bdag med par mkhyen pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The knowledge of equality is the knowledge that is the transformation of the afflicted mind, the knowledge that is the equality of self and non-self.

original: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa gnas gyur pa kun rdzob kyi @106b dngos po ma lus pa pad+ma'i 'dab ma ltar ma 'dres par mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa gnas gyur pa kun rdzob kyi @106b dngos po ma lus pa pad+ma'i 'dab ma ltar ma 'dres par mkhyen pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of individual knowledge is the knowledge that is the transformation of the mental consciousness, the knowledge that is the unmixed knowledge of all conventional things, like the petals of a lotus.

original: bya ba grub pa'i ye shes ni sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa gnas gyur pa 'gro ba rnams gdul ba'i bya ba gang yin pa ma lus pa mdzad pa mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba grub pa'i ye shes ni sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa gnas gyur pa 'gro ba rnams gdul ba'i bya ba gang yin pa ma lus pa mdzad pa mkhyen pa'o //
translated: The gnosis of successful activities is the transformation of the consciousnesses of the five senses, which is the knowledge of all the activities of guiding beings.

original: de dag bsdus pa ni sku gsum grub ces bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: de dag bsdus pa ni sku gsum grub ces bya bas bstan te /
translated: Their summary is indicated by “the three bodies are accomplished.”

original: de yang bsod nams kyi tshogs chen po'i 'bras bu ni /
analyzed: de yang bsod nams kyi tshogs chen po'i 'bras bu ni /
translated: Moreover, the result of the great accumulation of merit

original: gzugs kyi sku gnyis 'grub la /
analyzed: gzugs kyi sku gnyis 'grub la /
translated: is the accomplishment of the two form bodies.

original: ye shes kyi tshogs chen po'i 'bras bu ni chos kyi sku 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs chen po'i 'bras bu ni chos kyi sku 'grub pa'o //
translated: The result of the great accumulation of gnosis is the accomplishment of the dharmakāya.

original: de la me long lta bu'i ye shes ni chos kyi sku gzung ba dang 'dzin pa las grol ba rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba tsam gyi ye shes so //
analyzed: de la me long lta bu'i ye shes ni chos kyi sku gzung ba dang 'dzin pa las grol ba rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba tsam gyi ye shes so //
translated: Among them, the mirrorlike gnosis is the gnosis of the dharmakāya, which is free from subject and object and is merely the natural luminosity.

original: de'i chos stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa bzhi la sogs pa ye shes tha dad pa du ma tshogs pas na chos kyi tshogs yin la /
analyzed: de'i chos stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa bzhi la sogs pa ye shes tha dad pa du ma tshogs pas na chos kyi tshogs yin la /
translated: The accumulation of phenomena is the collection of many different kinds of gnosis, such as the ten powers and the four fearlessnesses.

original: chos kyi sku zhes bya ba ni k'a ya'i sgra tshogs la 'jug pas so //
analyzed: chos kyi sku zhes bya ba ni k'a ya'i sgra tshogs la 'jug pas so //
translated: The term dharmakāya is used because the term kāya is used for a collection.

original: ye shes de yang dngos su na longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku thugs gnyis su med pa'i ye shes so// so sor rtog pa dang mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ste /
analyzed: ye shes de yang dngos su na longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku thugs gnyis su med pa'i ye shes so// so sor rtog pa dang mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ste /
translated: The pristine wisdom of discernment and the pristine wisdom of equality are the body of perfect rapture.🔽Moreover, that body is liberated from dependence on the different sense-fields of pristine wisdom within that body, and it is the knower of the various conventional realities.

original: de yang sku de'i nang gi ye shes skye mched tha dad pa la rag las pa las grol ba kun rdzob sna tshogs mkhyen pa dang skur bstan pas gang 'dul bar 'os pa 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: de yang sku de'i nang gi ye shes skye mched tha dad pa la rag las pa las grol ba kun rdzob sna tshogs mkhyen pa dang skur bstan pas gang 'dul bar 'os pa 'dul ba'o //
translated: By means of the display of the body, it disciplines those who are to be disciplined.

original: des ni 'dir sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku thams cad kyi gzhi ni rnam par smin pa'i sku ste /
analyzed: des ni 'dir sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku thams cad kyi gzhi ni rnam par smin pa'i sku ste /
translated: Here, the basis of all the bodies of the Buddhas is the body of maturation.

original: de'i mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang / sgo lnga'i ye shes kyi 'od zer gyi snang ba las chos dang sprul pa'i skur bzhag cing /
analyzed: de'i mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang / sgo lnga'i ye shes kyi 'od zer gyi snang ba las chos dang sprul pa'i skur bzhag cing /
translated: From the light of the non-conceptual pristine wisdom of that body and the pristine wisdom of the five doors, the Dharma Body and the Emanation Body are posited.

original: de gnyis kyi rten ye shes dang bcas pa de nyid longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi rten ye shes dang bcas pa de nyid longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku zhes brjod do //
translated: And that very basis of those two bodies, together with the pristine wisdom, is called the Body of Perfect Rapture.

original: yang na bsod nams kyi tshogs mtha' yas pa las grub pa'i lus khyad par can dang / de'i 'od zer gzugs khyad par can du snang ba ni gzugs kyi sku gnyis te /
analyzed: yang na bsod nams kyi tshogs mtha' yas pa las grub pa'i lus khyad par can dang / de'i 'od zer gzugs khyad par can du snang ba ni gzugs kyi sku gnyis te /
translated: Or else, the two Bodies of Form are the special body produced from the infinite collection of merit, and the special appearance of its light rays.

original: gang mig gi yul du gyur pa de nyid gzugs so //
analyzed: gang mig gi yul du gyur pa de nyid gzugs so //
translated: That which is the object of the eye is form.

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bar snang ba'i ye shes ni gtso bo ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bar snang ba'i ye shes ni gtso bo ste /
translated: The intuition which is the appearance of natural luminosity is the principal one.

original: sna tshogs shes pa dang / bdag med par shes pa yang ye shes kyi tshogs las byung bar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs shes pa dang / bdag med par shes pa yang ye shes kyi tshogs las byung bar brjod par bya'o //
translated: The intuition which is the knowledge of the variety and the knowledge of selflessness should be said to arise from the collection of intuition.

original: de las gzhan pa bdag med pa tsam de ni don dam pa'i chos dkon mchog tu bzhag gi sangs rgyas su ni mi gzhag ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa bdag med pa tsam de ni don dam pa'i chos dkon mchog tu bzhag gi sangs rgyas su ni mi gzhag ste /
translated: But the mere selflessness which is other than that is posited as the ultimate jewel of Dharma, not as Buddha.

original: de ni rgyal ba rnams kyi ye shes kyi yul yin la /
analyzed: de ni rgyal ba rnams kyi ye shes kyi yul yin la /
translated: That is the object of the intuition of the Victors.

original: thob par bya ba'i 'bras bur gzhag par bya'o //🔽des na rang gi @107a * //
analyzed: thob par bya ba'i 'bras bur gzhag par bya'o // des na rang gi @107a * //
translated: It should be posited as the result to be attained.

original: mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i sku ni gsum kho nar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i sku ni gsum kho nar brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the body endowed with the character of the ultimate should be said to be only three.

original: de ni sku gsum po de'i bdag nyid las dang / dpe dang / mtshan nyid kyis gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir /🔽rnam rtog mi mnga' ci yang sa le mkhyen //
analyzed: de ni sku gsum po de'i bdag nyid las dang / dpe dang / mtshan nyid kyis gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir / rnam rtog mi mnga' ci yang sa le mkhyen //
translated: The three bodies are taught clearly by their nature, by example, and by definition.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He is free of conceptual thought, and yet he knows everything clearly.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i rigs gsum mam bzhi dang bral ba'i phyir rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i rigs gsum mam bzhi dang bral ba'i phyir rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' ba ste /
translated: He is free of conceptual thought because he is free of the three or four types of conceptual thought.

original: gnyis su 'dzin pa mtha' dag drungs nas phyung ba'i ye shes chen po'o //
analyzed: gnyis su 'dzin pa mtha' dag drungs nas phyung ba'i ye shes chen po'o //
translated: He is the great intuition which has uprooted all dualistic grasping.

original: de'i phyir mi mnga' zhes bya ba'i dgag pa 'di ni ma yin par dgag pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi mnga' zhes bya ba'i dgag pa 'di ni ma yin par dgag pa ste /
translated: Therefore, this negation “free of” is a non-implicative negation.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i rigs de dag ni yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i rigs de dag ni yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Those types of conceptual thought do not exist,

original: des dben pa'i ye shes rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ni mnga' bas so //
analyzed: des dben pa'i ye shes rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ni mnga' bas so //
translated: but the intuition free of them, which is naturally radiant, is present.

original: des na des ci yang rung ste chos ci yang rung ba rdul phra rab dang ri rab la sogs pa de dag sa le zhes bya ba rab tu gsal bar mkhyen pa ste /
analyzed: des na des ci yang rung ste chos ci yang rung ba rdul phra rab dang ri rab la sogs pa de dag sa le zhes bya ba rab tu gsal bar mkhyen pa ste /
translated: Therefore, he knows clearly everything, whatever it is, all phenomena, whatever they are, the subtle atoms and the great mountains, etc.

original: ji ltar mkhyen zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mkhyen zhe na /
translated: How does he know them?

original: sgra'i spyi'i rnam par rtog pa'i sgro btags pa dang skur ba btab pa dang bral zhing phan tshun mi sgrib la thogs pa med cing mun pa med la shel dang lhang tsher ltar gsal ba'i rnam par dbyer med par mkhyen te /
analyzed: sgra'i spyi'i rnam par rtog pa'i sgro btags pa dang skur ba btab pa dang bral zhing phan tshun mi sgrib la thogs pa med cing mun pa med la shel dang lhang tsher ltar gsal ba'i rnam par dbyer med par mkhyen te /
translated: It is free from the superimposition and denial of the general aspects of sound, and it is not mutually obstructive, unobstructed, not obscured, and it is not differentiated as clear like a crystal or a mirror.

original: de nyid ye shes de'i las yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ye shes de'i las yin no //
translated: That itself is the activity of that gnosis.

original: de'i dpe bstan pa ni chos sku mkha' 'dra zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i dpe bstan pa ni chos sku mkha' 'dra zhes bya ste /
translated: The example that illustrates that is stated in the line “The dharmakāya is like space.”

original: 'dus ma byas nam mkha' thogs pa med cing mi sgrib pa ltar me long lta bu'i ye shes kyang shes bya thams cad la thogs pa med cing sgrib pa med la /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas nam mkha' thogs pa med cing mi sgrib pa ltar me long lta bu'i ye shes kyang shes bya thams cad la thogs pa med cing sgrib pa med la /
translated: Just as unconditioned space is unobstructed and non-obscuring, mirror-like gnosis is also unobstructed and non-obscuring with regard to all objects of knowledge.

original: dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su ma chad par snang ba'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su ma chad par snang ba'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is said that it appears without the aspects and focal objects being differentiated.

original: 'dir ye shes lhag ma gsum ni gzugs la sogs pa dang / gang zag la bdag med pa tsam dang / 'dul ba'i 'gro ba'i bsam pa dang bag la nyal la sogs pa dang 'dul ba'i thabs shes pas yul so sor nges pa'i ye shes yin la /
analyzed: 'dir ye shes lhag ma gsum ni gzugs la sogs pa dang / gang zag la bdag med pa tsam dang / 'dul ba'i 'gro ba'i bsam pa dang bag la nyal la sogs pa dang 'dul ba'i thabs shes pas yul so sor nges pa'i ye shes yin la /
translated: Here, the remaining three exalted wisdoms are the exalted wisdom of individual knowledge of objects, since they are the exalted wisdoms that know forms and so forth, the mere selflessness of persons, the attitudes and predispositions of trainees, and so forth, and the methods of training.

original: ye shes 'di ni yul de dag dang bcas pa'i ye shes de dag nyid chos can du gyur pa dang / de'i chos nyid rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba spyi'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: ye shes 'di ni yul de dag dang bcas pa'i ye shes de dag nyid chos can du gyur pa dang / de'i chos nyid rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba spyi'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ste /
translated: This exalted wisdom is the exalted wisdom that knows all objects and their mode, since it is the exalted wisdoms that know those objects and their mode, the objects and their mode being the phenomena and their nature, the natural luminosity, which is the general characteristic.

original: chos can dang chos nyid du bcas pa mtha' dag mkhyen par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: chos can dang chos nyid du bcas pa mtha' dag mkhyen par gyur pa'o //
translated: It is the one that knows all objects and their mode.

original: gzugs sku mdzes sku ldan zhes bya ba ni mtshan dang dpe byad rab tu 'bar ba'i longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: gzugs sku mdzes sku ldan zhes bya ba ni mtshan dang dpe byad rab tu 'bar ba'i longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i sku'o //
translated: Having a beautiful body means having the form body, which is the complete enjoyment body blazing with major and minor marks and the emanation body.

original: sangs rgyas kyi don ni sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi don ni sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of buddha is as previously explained.

original: dpag bsam @107b 'dra zhes bya ba ni sku gsum char gyi dpe ste /
analyzed: dpag bsam @107b 'dra zhes bya ba ni sku gsum char gyi dpe ste /
translated: Like a wish-granting tree means that the three bodies are like examples of a wish-granting tree.

original: 'gro ba rnams kyis ji ltar sems kyis dpags shing bsams pa ltar yid la re ba yongs su rdzogs par byed pas na lha'i dpag bsam gyi shing chen po rnam pa bzhi po dang 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams kyis ji ltar sems kyis dpags shing bsams pa ltar yid la re ba yongs su rdzogs par byed pas na lha'i dpag bsam gyi shing chen po rnam pa bzhi po dang 'dra ba ste /
translated: It is like the four great wish fulfilling trees of the gods, because it fulfills the wishes of beings in accordance with their thoughts and intentions.🔽The praise says:

original: bsod nams dpag bsam shing khyod de ring gang las byung ;🔽/ zhes bstod pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bsod nams dpag bsam shing khyod de ring gang las byung ; / zhes bstod pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Today, merit tree, from where do you come?

original: de yang sku de dag gsum char yang sngon gyi smon lam gyi sa bon dpag tu med pa 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pas /
analyzed: de yang sku de dag gsum char yang sngon gyi smon lam gyi sa bon dpag tu med pa 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pas /
translated: Moreover, all three of those bodies are present as the nature of holding the seeds of immeasurable former aspirations.

original: sngon ji ltar smon lam btab pa bzhin du da ltar gdul bya'i don 'bad pa med par 'byung ba yin la /
analyzed: sngon ji ltar smon lam btab pa bzhin du da ltar gdul bya'i don 'bad pa med par 'byung ba yin la /
translated: Therefore, just as one made aspirations in the past, the benefit of those to be tamed occurs effortlessly in the present.

original: khyad par du gzugs kyi sku ni mthu thogs pa med par byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyi tshe ba'i gang zag dang 'gro ba yongs su smin par byed pa la dngos su yang 'jug go //
analyzed: khyad par du gzugs kyi sku ni mthu thogs pa med par byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyi tshe ba'i gang zag dang 'gro ba yongs su smin par byed pa la dngos su yang 'jug go //
translated: In particular, the form body directly engages in ripening bodhisattvas, individuals with limited perspective, and beings.

original: kha cig na re gzugs sku zhes bya ba ni spyir bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: kha cig na re gzugs sku zhes bya ba ni spyir bstan pa yin la /
translated: Some say: The term “form body” is a general indication.

original: mdzes skur ldan zhes bya ba ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o ;🔽/ dpag bsam 'dra zhes bya ba ni sprul pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: mdzes skur ldan zhes bya ba ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o ; / dpag bsam 'dra zhes bya ba ni sprul pa'i sku'o //
translated: The term “endowed with a beautiful body” refers to the enjoyment body.🔽The term “like a wish-granting tree” refers to the emanation body.

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni sku gsum char gyi dbang du byas pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni sku gsum char gyi dbang du byas pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: The term “buddha” refers to all three bodies.

original: de lta bu'i sku gsum po da dag la lus zhing gi rdul snyed du mos par sprul te phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i sku gsum po da dag la lus zhing gi rdul snyed du mos par sprul te phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba ste /
translated: With such bodies, he emanates bodies equal to the atoms of the buddhafields and prostrates.

original: tshig gi don snga ma ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: tshig gi don snga ma ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of the words is as before.🔽The twelve branches of excellent speech are concordant with reality.

original: chos nyid rgyu mthun gsung rab bcu gnyis dang // zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i chos la bstod pa ste /
analyzed: chos nyid rgyu mthun gsung rab bcu gnyis dang // zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i chos la bstod pa ste /
translated: This praises the Dharma of teaching.

original: chos nyid ces bya ba la chos nyid bdag rnam pa gnyis kyis dben pa stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: chos nyid ces bya ba la chos nyid bdag rnam pa gnyis kyis dben pa stong pa nyid de /
translated: Reality is emptiness, the absence of the two types of self-entity.

original: bdag med pa dang bdag dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pa rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i spyi'i mtshan nyid don dam pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa dang bdag dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pa rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i spyi'i mtshan nyid don dam pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The ultimate reality is the universal characteristic of natural luminosity, which is characterized by selflessness and the absence of self.

original: de'i rgyu mthun pa bstan pa'i chos bdag med par ston pa'i gsung rab ste /
analyzed: de'i rgyu mthun pa bstan pa'i chos bdag med par ston pa'i gsung rab ste /
translated: The teaching Dharma, which teaches selflessness, is the natural outflow of that.

original: 'dir mthun pa'i rgyu ni rgyu mthun pa ste bskyed par rung ba dang / thob par nus pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir mthun pa'i rgyu ni rgyu mthun pa ste bskyed par rung ba dang / thob par nus pa'o //
translated: Here, a concordant cause is a natural outflow, which is suitable to be produced and is able to be attained.

original: de la skyed par rung ba ni rgyu des phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub pa'i ye shes skyed pa'o //
analyzed: de la skyed par rung ba ni rgyu des phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub pa'i ye shes skyed pa'o //
translated: Among them, that which is suitable to be produced is the unmistaken, fully established gnosis that is produced by that cause.

original: thob par nus pa ni ye shes de skyes pas mi 'gyur ba'i yongs su grub pa de bzhin nyid de thob par nus pa'o //
analyzed: thob par nus pa ni ye shes de skyes pas mi 'gyur ba'i yongs su grub pa de bzhin nyid de thob par nus pa'o //
translated: That which is able to be attained is the unchanging, fully established suchness that is able to be attained when that gnosis is produced.

original: de dag ni rab tu phul du byung ba'i gsung yin pas gsung rab ste /
analyzed: de dag ni rab tu phul du byung ba'i gsung yin pas gsung rab ste /
translated: Since those are the most excellent speech, they are the scriptures.

original: phyi rol pa'i tshig la ni snga ma lta bu'i rung ba dang / nus pa med pas rab ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol pa'i tshig la ni snga ma lta bu'i rung ba dang / nus pa med pas rab ma yin no //
translated: The words of non-Buddhists are not the best because they lack the suitability and ability mentioned above.

original: bcu gnyis ni mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs @108a * //
analyzed: bcu gnyis ni mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs @108a * //
translated: The twelve are the sutra collection, the geya, the vyakarana, the gatha, the udana, the itivrttaka, the jataka, the vaipulya, the adbhutadharma, and the upadesa.

original: kyis bsnyad pa'i sde dang / lung du bstan pa dang / tshigs su bcad pa dang / ched du brjod pa dang / gleng gzhi dang / rtogs pa brjod pa dang / de lta bu byung ba dang / skyes pa'i rabs dang / shin tu rgyas pa dang /
analyzed: kyis bsnyad pa'i sde dang / lung du bstan pa dang / tshigs su bcad pa dang / ched du brjod pa dang / gleng gzhi dang / rtogs pa brjod pa dang / de lta bu byung ba dang / skyes pa'i rabs dang / shin tu rgyas pa dang /
translated: the category of statements,🔽the category of predictions,🔽the category of verses,🔽the category of exclamations,🔽the category of narratives,🔽the category of biographies,🔽the category of former events,🔽the category of jātakas,🔽the category of extensive teachings,🔽

original: rmad du byung ba dang / gtan la phab pa'i sde zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rmad du byung ba dang / gtan la phab pa'i sde zhes bya ba ste /
translated: 1. the class of Discourses, 2. the class of Discourses in Prose and Verse, 3. the class of Predictions, 4. the class of Stanzas, 5. the class of Expositions, 6. the class of Manifestly Enlightened Discourses, 7. the class of Birth Stories, 8. the class of Extensive Discourses, 9. the class of Marvels, and 10. the class of Discourses on the Nature of Discipline.

original: de dag dang po ni ston pa'i zhal nas grag pa'o //
analyzed: de dag dang po ni ston pa'i zhal nas grag pa'o //
translated: The first of these was heard from the mouth of the Teacher.

original: de'i 'og tu ni gang zag gi blo la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ni gang zag gi blo la gnas pa'o //
translated: After that, it was preserved in the minds of individuals.

original: de'i 'og tu glegs bam la bris pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu glegs bam la bris pa'o //
translated: After that, it was written down in books.

original: de yang dang por de la dmigs nas thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab skye zhing de nas bsgoms pas chos nyid de thob pas mthun pa'i rgyu brgyud pa nyid du nges pa'o //
analyzed: de yang dang por de la dmigs nas thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab skye zhing de nas bsgoms pas chos nyid de thob pas mthun pa'i rgyu brgyud pa nyid du nges pa'o //
translated: Moreover, first, having observed that, the wisdom born of hearing and the wisdom born of reflection arise. Then, through meditation, one attains that reality. Thus, it is ascertained that it is the indirect cause.

original: de bas na slob dpon ba su ban dhus rnam bshad rigs par bshad pa /
analyzed: de bas na slob dpon ba su ban dhus rnam bshad rigs par bshad pa /
translated: Therefore, Master Vasubandhu explains in the Rational System of Exposition:

original: ston pa'i zhal nas byung ba skye bo'i mig gi rab rib zhi bar mdzad pa bkra shis kyi //
analyzed: ston pa'i zhal nas byung ba skye bo'i mig gi rab rib zhi bar mdzad pa bkra shis kyi //
translated: The Teacher said, “Place in your mind this auspicious source, which clears away the eye-diseases of beings.

original: 'byung gnas sems la zhog cig gang phyir 'di ni lus can rnams kyi rna ba'i bdud rtsi dang ; / nyon mongs pa yi nang kun sel bar mdzad pa yin pas de don yang dag bsam par gyis //
analyzed: 'byung gnas sems la zhog cig gang phyir 'di ni lus can rnams kyi rna ba'i bdud rtsi dang ; / nyon mongs pa yi nang kun sel bar mdzad pa yin pas de don yang dag bsam par gyis //
translated: Since this is the nectar of the ears of embodied beings, and since it completely clears away the afflictions, you should think about its meaning.

original: rgyu 'di rnams kyis rtag tu gus par sangs rgyas kyi ni gsung dag mnyan par bya ba'i rigs //
analyzed: rgyu 'di rnams kyis rtag tu gus par sangs rgyas kyi ni gsung dag mnyan par bya ba'i rigs //
translated: For these reasons, it is always appropriate to listen respectfully to the speech of the Buddha.”

original: zhes so // chos la skye 'gag med cing spros las dben //
analyzed: zhes so // chos la skye 'gag med cing spros las dben //
translated: The Dharma is without origination or cessation, and is free from conceptual elaborations.

original: de la dmigs te yon tan kun grub pa //🔽zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i chos la bstod pa ste /
analyzed: de la dmigs te yon tan kun grub pa // zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i chos la bstod pa ste /
translated: By focusing on it, all good qualities are achieved.🔽This is a praise of the ultimate Dharma.

original: chos ni dam pa'i chos so //
analyzed: chos ni dam pa'i chos so //
translated: “Dharma” refers to the excellent Dharma.

original: de la don dam par skye ba dang 'gag pa med cing gzhan yang spros pa ste rtag pa dang / chad pa dang / 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba dang / gcig pa dang / tha dad pa'i spros pa de dag las dben pa'o ;
analyzed: de la don dam par skye ba dang 'gag pa med cing gzhan yang spros pa ste rtag pa dang / chad pa dang / 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba dang / gcig pa dang / tha dad pa'i spros pa de dag las dben pa'o ;
translated: It is free from the elaborations of arising and ceasing ultimately, and it is also free from other elaborations, such as permanence, annihilation, coming, going, sameness, and difference.

original: / de yang dam pa'i chos ni bdag med pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: / de yang dam pa'i chos ni bdag med pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
translated: The sublime Dharma is the nature of selflessness.

original: spros pa de dag ni bdag tu 'dzin pa'i dbang gis btags pa tsam du zad pas na bdag tu 'dzin pa log ma thag tu de dag kyang ldog la /
analyzed: spros pa de dag ni bdag tu 'dzin pa'i dbang gis btags pa tsam du zad pas na bdag tu 'dzin pa log ma thag tu de dag kyang ldog la /
translated: Since those elaborations are merely imputed due to the power of grasping at self, they cease as soon as grasping at self is reversed.

original: bdag med pa'i ngang la de dag dang po nas kyang med kyi btags pa glo bur bar zad pa'o ;
analyzed: bdag med pa'i ngang la de dag dang po nas kyang med kyi btags pa glo bur bar zad pa'o ;
translated: In the state of selflessness, they never existed in the first place; they are merely adventitious imputations.

original: / de ltar spros pa dang bral ba bdag med pa de la bdag med par shes rab rnam pa gsum gyis dmigs pas bdag tu 'dzin pa la sogs de ma thag tu 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan thun mong ba rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa
analyzed: / de ltar spros pa dang bral ba bdag med pa de la bdag med par shes rab rnam pa gsum gyis dmigs pas bdag tu 'dzin pa la sogs de ma thag tu 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan thun mong ba rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa
translated: Thus, in that selflessness free from elaborations, the three kinds of wisdom that observe selflessness immediately destroy the grasping at self and so forth.

original: 'phags pa'i 'bras bu rnam pa du ma dang / thun mong ma yin @108b pa stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan kun grub pas na 'phags pa'i gang zag rnams ni 'dus ma byas las rab tu byung ba'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i 'bras bu rnam pa du ma dang / thun mong ma yin @108b pa stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan kun grub pas na 'phags pa'i gang zag rnams ni 'dus ma byas las rab tu byung ba'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Because they have accomplished the many aspects of the fruits of the noble ones and the uncommon qualities such as the powers and the fearlessnesses, the noble ones are said to have emerged from the unconditioned.

original: legs rgyu dam pa'i chos la zhes bya ba ni lam gyi chos la bstod pa ste //
analyzed: legs rgyu dam pa'i chos la zhes bya ba ni lam gyi chos la bstod pa ste //
translated: The Dharma of the excellent cause is praised.

original: de la legs pa ni nges par legs pa ste nye bar zhi ba'i bde ba'o //
analyzed: de la legs pa ni nges par legs pa ste nye bar zhi ba'i bde ba'o //
translated: Excellent refers to definite excellence, the bliss of peace.

original: de'i rgyu ni skyed par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rgyu ni skyed par byed pa ste /
translated: Its cause is that which generates it.

original: des bdag med pa'i ye shes bskyed la /
analyzed: des bdag med pa'i ye shes bskyed la /
translated: It generates the wisdom of selflessness.

original: des kyang nges par legs pa de thob pas so //
analyzed: des kyang nges par legs pa de thob pas so //
translated: And that also attains that definite excellence.

original: 'dis zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i sngon du rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin skyes pa de ni legs rgyu mthar thug pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dis zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i sngon du rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin skyes pa de ni legs rgyu mthar thug pa yin la /
translated: This refers to the vajra like concentration that arises prior to the knowledge of elimination and nonarising. That is the ultimate excellent cause.

original: des mjug btul ba mthong ba'i lam gyi bar gyi ye shes ni legs rgyur rig par bya'o //
analyzed: des mjug btul ba mthong ba'i lam gyi bar gyi ye shes ni legs rgyur rig par bya'o //
translated: The wisdom of the path of seeing that is subdued by that should be known as the excellent cause.

original: de nyid dam pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid dam pa ste /
translated: That is the holy Dharma.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis nyams su myong bar gyur pa dang / ltung ba las 'dzin pas na dam pa'i chos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis nyams su myong bar gyur pa dang / ltung ba las 'dzin pas na dam pa'i chos zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the holy Dharma because it is experienced by the holy ones, and because it holds one back from falling into the lower realms.

original: de la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The phrase I pay homage to that is as explained above.🔽The assembly of the noble ones is praised in the following lines:🔽Those who have entered the grounds, having gradually cleared away🔽The afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience

original: nyon mongs sgrib dang shes bya'i sgrib pa dag / gnyen pos rim par bsal nas sar zhugs shing //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'phags pa'i dge 'dun la bstod pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs sgrib dang shes bya'i sgrib pa dag / gnyen pos rim par bsal nas sar zhugs shing // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'phags pa'i dge 'dun la bstod pa ste /
translated: with the antidotes.

original: de la sems kun nas nyon mongs par byed pas na nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: de la sems kun nas nyon mongs par byed pas na nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: Here, the afflictions are those that afflict the mind.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa drug go //🔽de dag nyid sgrib pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa drug go // de dag nyid sgrib pa ste /
translated: They are the six afflictions such as attachment.

original: zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i ye shes la sgrib cing mthong ba'i gegs byed pas so //
analyzed: zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i ye shes la sgrib cing mthong ba'i gegs byed pas so //
translated: They are obstructions because they obstruct the wisdom of the knowledge of elimination and the knowledge of nonarising, and they obstruct seeing.

original: shes bya ni chos kyi dbyings kun du 'gro ba rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: shes bya ni chos kyi dbyings kun du 'gro ba rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: The object of knowledge is the all-pervading expanse of reality, which is naturally luminous.

original: de la sgrib pa ni rjod par byed pa sgra'i spyi la yod par 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: de la sgrib pa ni rjod par byed pa sgra'i spyi la yod par 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The obstruction to that is the apprehension of the general characteristics of the words that express it.

original: dngos su na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rigs ji snyed pa'o ;
analyzed: dngos su na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rigs ji snyed pa'o ;
translated: In fact, it is of the type of the discrimination of the apprehended object and the apprehending subject.

original: / sgrib pa de gnyis ka yang rab tu dbye ba mang po dang ldan pas na dag ces pa mang po'i tshig can no //
analyzed: / sgrib pa de gnyis ka yang rab tu dbye ba mang po dang ldan pas na dag ces pa mang po'i tshig can no //
translated: Since both of these obscurations are endowed with many divisions, the word “purified” has a plural ending.

original: gnyis pos zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa gnyen shes pa'i ye shes kyis so //🔽rim par bsal nas zhes bya ba ni de dag cig car mi spong gi dang po mthong spang spong la //
analyzed: gnyis pos zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa gnyen shes pa'i ye shes kyis so // rim par bsal nas zhes bya ba ni de dag cig car mi spong gi dang po mthong spang spong la //
translated: “By the two” means by the intuition of the realization of the two kinds of selflessness.

original: de'i 'og tu bsgom pas spang bar bya ba spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bsgom pas spang bar bya ba spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Having been gradually eliminated” means that they are not eliminated simultaneously, but rather that the eliminations of the objects to be eliminated by the path of vision precede, and the eliminations of the objects to be eliminated by the path of cultivation follow.

original: de las 'bras bu thob pa bstan pa ni sar zhugs shing zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de las 'bras bu thob pa bstan pa ni sar zhugs shing zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The teaching of the attainment of the result from that is stated in the line “having entered the stages.

original: sa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sa ste /
analyzed: sa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sa ste /
translated: ” The stage is the supramundane stage,

original: brgyad pa dang / mthong ba dang / bsrabs pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / byas pa rtogs pa dang / rang @109a * //
analyzed: brgyad pa dang / mthong ba dang / bsrabs pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / byas pa rtogs pa dang / rang @109a * //
translated: the eighth, the vision, the thinning, the separation from passion, the realization of what is to be done, the self-consecration, and the culmination.

original: sangs rgyas kyis la zhugs pa dang / yang rab tu dga' ba dang / dri ma med pa nas chos kyi sprin gyi bar la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis la zhugs pa dang / yang rab tu dga' ba dang / dri ma med pa nas chos kyi sprin gyi bar la zhugs pa'o //
translated: One who has entered the path of seeing is one who has entered the first ground, the Joyous, and one who has entered from the second ground, the Stainless, up to the tenth ground, the Cloud of Dharma.

original: 'dir bden pa bzhi rnam pa bcu drug dag yid la byed pa'i ye shes kyi skad cig bcu drug gis phra rgyas brgyad cu rtsa brgyad spangs pas mthong ba'i lam la brgyad pa'am rab tu dga' ba'i sa pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir bden pa bzhi rnam pa bcu drug dag yid la byed pa'i ye shes kyi skad cig bcu drug gis phra rgyas brgyad cu rtsa brgyad spangs pas mthong ba'i lam la brgyad pa'am rab tu dga' ba'i sa pa'o //
translated: Here, the path of seeing is the eighth ground or the Joyous ground, because the sixteen moments of transcendent wisdom that take the four truths as their object eliminate the eighty-eight negative tendencies.

original: de'i 'og tu tshul de nyid kyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba bcu spangs pa las ni nyan thos dang rang rgyal ba'i sa lhag ma dag gzhag ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu tshul de nyid kyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba bcu spangs pa las ni nyan thos dang rang rgyal ba'i sa lhag ma dag gzhag ste /
translated: After that, the remaining grounds of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas are posited from the elimination of the ten that are to be eliminated by the path of meditation.

original: 'dod pa'i rnam pa gsum pa'i bar dang / rnam pa drug pa dang / dgu pa dang / srid rtse'i dgu pa zad pa las mthor ba dang / bsrabs pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / byas pa rtogs pa'i sa pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i rnam pa gsum pa'i bar dang / rnam pa drug pa dang / dgu pa dang / srid rtse'i dgu pa zad pa las mthor ba dang / bsrabs pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / byas pa rtogs pa'i sa pa'o //
translated: The grounds of the peak, the forbearing, and the highest worldly realizations are posited from the elimination of the three types of desire realm afflictions, the elimination of the six types of afflictions of the two upper realms, the elimination of the nine types of afflictions of the peak of existence, and the elimination of the ninth type of afflictions of the summit of existence, respectively.

original: cig car kho nar spangs pa dang lam rdzogs pa ni bse ru lta bu'i sa'o //
analyzed: cig car kho nar spangs pa dang lam rdzogs pa ni bse ru lta bu'i sa'o //
translated: The simultaneous abandonment and completion of the path is the stage of the rhinoceros-like pratyekabuddha.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa lhag ma rnams ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yongs su rdzogs pa las rnam par gzhag par rig par bya zhing //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa lhag ma rnams ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yongs su rdzogs pa las rnam par gzhag par rig par bya zhing //
translated: The remaining bodhisattva stages are to be understood as being established from the completion of the perfections.

original: de dag gi nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ni rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis cig car spong la /
analyzed: de dag gi nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ni rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis cig car spong la /
translated: The afflictive obstructions that are to be abandoned by the bodhisattva through meditation are simultaneously abandoned by the vajra-like samadhi.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa ni sa re re la yang rim gyis spang ngo //
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa ni sa re re la yang rim gyis spang ngo //
translated: The obstructions to omniscience are abandoned in sequence on each stage.

original: la la ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa yang sa re re la rim gyis spong ste /
analyzed: la la ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa yang sa re re la rim gyis spong ste /
translated: Some say that the afflictive obstructions are also abandoned in sequence on each stage.

original: spong byed ni chos la bdag med pa'i ye shes kyis so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: spong byed ni chos la bdag med pa'i ye shes kyis so zhes zer ro //
translated: The abandoner is the wisdom of the selflessness of phenomena.

original: de ltar ye shes kyi tshogs la gnas pa bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar ye shes kyi tshogs la gnas pa bshad nas /
translated: Thus, having explained the accumulation of wisdom,🔽now, in order to teach the accumulation of merit,

original: da ni bsod nams kyi tshogs la gnas pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni bsod nams kyi tshogs la gnas pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: he says,

original: sems can don mdzad sangs rgyas zhing sbyong ba //🔽zhes smos te /
analyzed: sems can don mdzad sangs rgyas zhing sbyong ba //🔽zhes smos te /
translated: Performing the welfare of sentient beings and purifying the buddhafield,

original: sems can rnams kyi don ni dgos pa ste bde ba dang phan pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi don ni dgos pa ste bde ba dang phan pa'o //
translated: The aim of sentient beings is their benefit and happiness.

original: de dag mdzad pa ni bsdu ba'i dngos po dang / tshad med pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dag gis ji ltar nus par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de dag mdzad pa ni bsdu ba'i dngos po dang / tshad med pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dag gis ji ltar nus par byed pa'o //
translated: Their performance is their performance by means of the means of gathering, the immeasurables, and the perfections, as is fitting.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi zhing ni snod dang bcud do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi zhing ni snod dang bcud do //
translated: The field of the Buddhas is the world receptacle and its inhabitants.

original: de dag sbyong ba ni rgyal ba'i yum las gsungs pa ltar te /
analyzed: de dag sbyong ba ni rgyal ba'i yum las gsungs pa ltar te /
translated: Their purification is as taught in the Mother of the Conquerors:

original: sems can gos ngan pa dag mthong na bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing der sems can rnams lus gos dang rgyan gyis brgyan par gyur cig ces smon lam gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gos ngan pa dag mthong na bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing der sems can rnams lus gos dang rgyan gyis brgyan par gyur cig ces smon lam gdab par bya'o //
translated: “When I see sentient beings with poor clothing, I will make the aspiration: ‘May the sentient beings in my Buddha-field have bodies adorned with clothes and ornaments.’

original: me tog dbul na bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing der dus thams cad pa'i me tog rab tu rgyas par gyur cig ces smon lam gdab @109b par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: me tog dbul na bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing der dus thams cad pa'i me tog rab tu rgyas par gyur cig ces smon lam gdab @109b par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: When I offer flowers, I will make the aspiration: ‘May the flowers in my Buddha-field be in full bloom at all times.’

original: mdor na sangs rgyas kyi zhing ni smon lam gyi mthus sbyong bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mdor na sangs rgyas kyi zhing ni smon lam gyi mthus sbyong bar rig par bya'o //
translated: In brief, you should understand that the Buddha-field is purified by the power of aspiration.

original: 'phags pa'i dge 'dun che la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i dge 'dun che la zhes bya ba la /
translated: The great noble community.

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos las ring du song bas 'phags pa ste /
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos las ring du song bas 'phags pa ste /
translated: They are noble because they have gone far from evil, nonvirtuous dharmas.

original: dge 'dun ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dge 'dun ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The community is as explained above.

original: che ba ni grangs dang yon tan gyis che ba ste /
analyzed: che ba ni grangs dang yon tan gyis che ba ste /
translated: Great means great in number and great in good qualities.

original: grangs mtha' yas pa dang / legs par zhugs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan chen po mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grangs mtha' yas pa dang / legs par zhugs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan chen po mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are great in number because they are infinite, and they are great in good qualities because they possess the great qualities of being well entered and so on.

original: phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba ni bstod pa dang bcas pa'i lus kyi yan lag thams cad rab tu 'dud pa'o //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba ni bstod pa dang bcas pa'i lus kyi yan lag thams cad rab tu 'dud pa'o //
translated: Prostration means bowing all the limbs of the body with praise.

original: de ltar yon tan mtha' dag 'dus pa'i dkon mchog gsum la phyag 'tshal nas de dag la skyabs su song na ngan song rnams su mi skye bar lha'i gnas su skye ste /
analyzed: de ltar yon tan mtha' dag 'dus pa'i dkon mchog gsum la phyag 'tshal nas de dag la skyabs su song na ngan song rnams su mi skye bar lha'i gnas su skye ste /
translated: Thus, having prostrated to the Three Jewels who embody all good qualities, if one goes for refuge to them, one will not be born in the lower realms but will be born in the divine realms.

original: gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba ni chos snang ba'i sgo ste /
analyzed: gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba ni chos snang ba'i sgo ste /
translated: Going for refuge to the Three Jewels is the door to the light of the Dharma.

original: ngan 'gro las yang dag par 'da' ba'o zhes gsungs pa dang / 'di ltar shin tu dang ba'i sems dang yid gzhungs pas gzhan du ma yengs pa'i yid gsal bas sangs rgyas sam chos sam dge 'dun la skyabs su song na /
analyzed: ngan 'gro las yang dag par 'da' ba'o zhes gsungs pa dang / 'di ltar shin tu dang ba'i sems dang yid gzhungs pas gzhan du ma yengs pa'i yid gsal bas sangs rgyas sam chos sam dge 'dun la skyabs su song na /
translated: In this way, with a very clear mind and sharp intellect, if one goes for refuge to the Buddha, Dharma, or Sangha with a clear mind undistracted elsewhere,

original: de 'chi ba'i dus byas nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten zur na gnas pa zhes bya ba der shin tu dang ba'i sems dang skyabs su song ba'i rgyus skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de 'chi ba'i dus byas nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten zur na gnas pa zhes bya ba der shin tu dang ba'i sems dang skyabs su song ba'i rgyus skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then at the time of death, due to the cause of having a very clear mind and going for refuge, one will be born in the higher realms in a world called Dwelling in a Corner.

original: der skyes nas kyang de'i lus gzi brjid dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: der skyes nas kyang de'i lus gzi brjid dang ldan zhing /
translated: Having been born there, one's body will be radiant.

original: lus rang gi 'od kyis brgyan la bde bar gnas par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: lus rang gi 'od kyis brgyan la bde bar gnas par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: One will dwell in bliss, adorned with one's own bodily light.

original: gal te phyag 'tshal ba dang skyabs su song ba'i dge ba de yongs su bsngo ba dang ldan na ni ji ltar bsngos pa'i thar pa'i rgyur 'gyur bar rig par bya'o ;
analyzed: gal te phyag 'tshal ba dang skyabs su song ba'i dge ba de yongs su bsngo ba dang ldan na ni ji ltar bsngos pa'i thar pa'i rgyur 'gyur bar rig par bya'o ;
translated: If that virtue of prostration and going for refuge is dedicated, it should be understood that it becomes the cause of liberation as dedicated.

original: / de ltar nyes pa kun spangs shing //
analyzed: / de ltar nyes pa kun spangs shing //
translated: Thus, having abandoned all faults,

original: yon tan mtha' yas gter gyur pa //
analyzed: yon tan mtha' yas gter gyur pa //
translated: The inexhaustible treasure of good qualities,🔽The words of praise to the Three Jewels,

original: dkon mchog gsum gyi bstod pa'i tshig / cung zad bshad pas dge ba'i tshogs //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum gyi bstod pa'i tshig / cung zad bshad pas dge ba'i tshogs //
translated: By the virtue that I have gained by explaining them a little,

original: gang thob de yis 'gro ba rnams //
analyzed: gang thob de yis 'gro ba rnams //
translated: May all beings🔽Dwell in the state of Buddhahood.

original: sangs rgyas sa la gnas par shog / dkon mchog gsum la bstod pa'i 'grel pa slob dpon rgyal ba'i sras kyis mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: sangs rgyas sa la gnas par shog / dkon mchog gsum la bstod pa'i 'grel pa slob dpon rgyal ba'i sras kyis mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary on the praise to the Three Jewels composed by the master Jinaputra is complete.

original: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po dzny'ana sh'anti dang / bod kyi lo ts'a ba bande dpal gyi lhun po'i sdes bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o//
analyzed: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po dzny'ana sh'anti dang / bod kyi lo ts'a ba bande dpal gyi lhun po'i sdes bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o//
translated: The Indian abbot Jñānaśānti and the Tibetan translator Bandé Palgyi Lhünpo translated, revised, and finalized it.
